text: Beijing is approaching the final stage
of its gargantuan makeover in
preparation for the 2008 Olympics the
first thing visitors to Beijing will see
is the modern looking new terminal of
the airport designed by Lord Foster and
constructed at a cost of 3.6 5 billion
dollars created in the shape of a dragon
lord foster paid meticulous attention to
phone Shui in its design the scales on
top of the large building face southeast
providing heat by capturing Sun in the
winter while cooling the building off in
the summer by providing shade auspicious
Chinese symbols and colors of luck
abound in homage to the Forbidden City
the terminal which began operating in
late February is yet another
record-breaking Chinese infrastructure
project covering 14 million square feet
it is expected to accommodate 580,000
flights per year by 2015 outpacing
London's Heathrow Airport it will also
provide for traveling in style 64
Western and Chinese restaurants in
addition to 90 retail stores give
passengers plenty to do in their free
time there is even a shop offering
massages for tired travelers a light
rail terminal scheduled to be ready for
the Olympics will speed passengers to
Beijing's downtown in under 20 minutes
yet the vastness of this futuristic
vision didn't come without a cost some
10,000 residents saw their homes
destroyed to make way for the new
terminal in Beijing this is jimmy wang
for the new york times
